The kindergarten students' final project in Science was a SCIENCE FAIR!

Students were able to finally ask the questions what, when, how, where, and finally WHY. Students came up with a question, they wrote a hypothesis, they wrote out the materials and steps, they experimented, displayed the results in a creative manner, and presented the results. The students used the scientific method to answer all those WH questions they always ask their grownups.

As you can see, the students had fun while learning. If this motivates you, please feel free to complete a science experiment this summer to continue the fun of investigating.

Have fun!

High School Guidance Counselor Molly Austin recently took part in a day of community service at Mitzvah Circle Foundation in Harleysville, PA.

During Molly's day of volunteering, she made approximately 25 care packages that will be distributed to local families in need. She also sorted through more than 20 bags of donations so future volunteers can pack those items into care packages!

Thanks for giving back to our community, Molly!

The kindergarten students did an author study on the best selling author and Illustrator, Eric Carle. They learned about how he illustrated over 70 books, writing most of them. The students had fun recreating Eric Carle's unique art style and comparing his different books teaching about time, days of the week, colors, feelings and so much more!

We are so glad you had fun exploring Eric Carle's work!
